result.execSummary:
All charges against Rodolfo Rivera in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodolfo Rivera is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodolfo Rivera

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rodolfo Rivera not in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Rodolfo Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Case set for pretrial conference.  State's essential witness is not cooperative.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/23/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BB and LD.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rodolfo Rivera in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/1/22 @ 2p
